00015 /// \file
00016 /// Provides the IEEE754binary32 class.
00017 
00018 #ifndef __IEEE754_HPP
00019 #define __IEEE754_HPP
00020 
00021 #include <types.hpp>
00022 
00023 /// An IEEE 754 binary32 floating point number representation.
00024 /**
00025  * Used to convert between the platform specific floating point representation and an IEEE 754 binary32 representation.
00026  * 
00027  * This implementation assumes that on the used platform \c float is already an IEEE 754 binary32 floating point number.
00028  * Platforms can \ref fileoverloading "overload this file" if any conversion is needed.
00029  */
00030 class IEEE754binary32 {
00031         
00032     private:
00033         float value;
00034         
00035     public:
00036         
00037         /// Convert from a Number.
00038         IEEE754binary32(Number number) : value(number) {}
00039         
00040         /// Convert to a Number.
00041         operator Number() { return value; }
00042         
00043         /// Convert from the IEEE 754 binary32 4 byte representation.
00044         IEEE754binary32(Int8 data[4]) : value(*reinterpret_cast<float *>(data)) {}
00045         
00046         /// Convert to the IEEE 754 binary32 4 byte representation.
00047         operator Int8 * () { return reinterpret_cast<Int8 *>(&value); }
00048         
00049 };
00050 
00051 #endif
00052
